name: Veteran Affairs Office Website
description: Developed a portion of the Veteran’s Affairs Office website in an agile team of seven other software developers.
The front-end was written in Typescript utilizing the Angular framework.
Utilized Github for source control and Travis CI for continuous integration.
Unit tested the project with over 98% coverage using Jasmine.

name: Bytebook
description: Cookbook web application for creating, sharing, and viewing recipes.
Front-end  written in ReactJS while utilizing the Material UI library.
Back-end written in NodeJS using Express to implement REST API calls.
AWS RDS mySQL database for retrieving, updating, and inserting account information and  recipes.
JSON Web Tokens for user identification and security.

name: The Home Depot Project
description: Developed a new web application for the Home Depot based around connecting their product database with an external API called Hover.
The project was conducted in a scrum team of six developers.
The front-end was written in ReactJS while heavily using the Material-UI library.
The back-end was developed using Express to develop new API end-points from scratch.
Data was stored and retrieved using a NoSQL database.
GitHub was used for source control with Travis CI acting as a continuous integration server.
The application was house on Google Cloud Platform with Kubernetes being used as a release manager.

name: The Homeless API
description: Created a new set of API endpoints used for retrieving the homeless populations of major US cities.
Developed the API using NodeJS with the Express framework.
Stored the city and population info on a mySQL database that is used heavily throughout the project.

name: Connect Four Android App
description: Created a connect-four Android app.
Other than developing the user interface and animations using Android Studio, the entire app was written in Java.
The app also utilized wireless sockets to enable online multiplayer.

name: jammming
description: Developed a web application that connects to the Spotify music API to create, edit, and delete user-created playlists.
Used ReactJS to create a dynamic user interface and playlist creation.
Utilized OAUTH and json web tokens to properly communicate with Spotify API.

name: Internet Relay Chat
description: Constructed a new internet relay chat protocol. The IRC allows clients to connect to a server, create and join chat rooms, and send messages to other clients who are part of the same chat rooms.
Client and server sides of the application were written in Java and utilized the Apache HTTP Server library to handle the communication between the client and server.

name: Vehicle Diagnostic Tool
description: Advance the capabilities of a next-generation vehicle diagnostic tool.
Code added is written in C and machine code which results in a faster tool.
Enhance the tool’s capability to communicate with numerous vehicle types via the CAN Bus protocol.
The tool includes bluetooth and USB capabilities which revolve around sending JSON messages to and from the device.

Implemented many OEM diagnostic functions for the tool including advanced Diagnostic Trouble Coding, Stationary Desoot, ABS Initialization, Tire Size Adjustment, Transmission Initialization, and many more.

name: CAN Bus Vehicle Emulator
description: Developed a new tool used for testing a client’s vehicle diagnostic tool. The tool allows the development team to test the many CAN functionalities of the diagnostic tool without the use of an actual vehicle present.
Constructed the emulator from scratch using C# while also using my knowledge of the CAN Bus to emulate many different vehicle types.
The emulator has been referred as scalable, reusable, and invaluable toward the advancement of vehicle diagnostic tools.

name: XV6 Operating System
description: Advanced the capabilities of an iteration of the Linux OS named XV6.
All code added was written with a mix of C and assembly language.

Notable improvements to the OS include valuable system calls and restructured the internal process scheduler to utilize more powerful data structures which improved processing speed from O(n) to O(log(n)).
